member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.XPathFilterAdapter
member.summary: Class for converting Monitoring Data Filters into XPathFilter expressions. By default, a client subscribing for Monitoring Events receives all events from lines being connected to this OIB Core. The XmlPathFilterAdapter allows to define a filter which filters out Monitoring events at the OIB Core level for specific lines, stations or by a factory layout elements so that this specific client does not receive all monitoring events of the full factory. This reduces the system load significantly.
member.remarks: All types are queried with the Equals operator. So if you want a complex expression that for instance returns all the Stations underneath an Isa95Path (Factory Layout Element) Path such as Enterprise:Site:ProductionLine:SiplaceLine, you need to use the advanced XPath query (not the XPathFilterAdapter object). The XPathFilterAdapter object only builds simple queries using the = operator currently.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.XPathFilterAdapter.#ctor(Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.XPathFilterDataType,System.String)
member.summary: The constructor for initializing the Adapter with a Data Type and Data value.
member.param: The Data Type upon which to build the filter with.
The Value associated with the Data Type selected.
member.remarks: All types are queried with the Equals operator. So if you want a complex expression that for instance returns all the Stations underneath an Isa95Path (Factory Layout Element) Path such as Enterprise:Site:ProductionLine:SiplaceLine, you need to use the advanced XPath query (not the XPathFilterAdapter object). The XPathFilterAdapter object only builds simple queries using the = operator currently.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.Monitoring.MaxObjectCacheLifeSpan
member.summary: Maximum time span that objects will be cached in the Object Cache after last access. If an object has been used in between, it will not be removed by the automatic logic. Default is one 8 hours. Can be set either through this field or in the app.config under "Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.MaxObjectCacheLifeSpan" For immediate removal, set this to TimeSpan.Zero. Valid range is from TimeSpan.Zero to 7 days.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.Monitoring.UseSecureEndpointsWhenConnectingToAdapter
member.summary:
When the client receives an event from a Monitoring Adapter and the client has not yet initialized a connection to the adapter previously, then this Monitoring Proxy will automatically connect to it when trying to load objects for the first time. These objects are typically: A Station / Line Property in an event, a Recipe, TrackEntries, FeederLocations, PickupErrors. Inside the event data are also endpoints so that this proxy knows where the adapter can be reached. It sends the secure and un-secure endpoints. If set to true, the secure endpoint will be used to contact the Monitoring Adapter (which means that the adapter's certificate needs to be trusted on the computer where this client application is running). If set to false, the un-secure endpoint is used instead.
This property is initialized with true if not explicitly set to false. You can also set this property via the app.config under appSettings, key "Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.UseSecureEndpointsWhenConnectingToAdapter"

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.Monitoring.ClearOnlyIfNumberOfObjectsInCacheAreGreaterThan
member.summary: Automatic removal of cached objects is only done if the amount of cached objects exceeds this number. By default it is 0 (always remove). Can be set either through this field or in the app.config under "Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.ClearOnlyIfNumberOfObjectsInCacheAreGreaterThan" Valid range is from 0 to 10000

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.RecipeChangeEvent
member.summary: Only for SSW 70x and later. Occurs whenever WORKS OIS detected a line job guid change with the production start of a board at station.
member.param: The sender of the event (this object)
The Event args describing the contents.
member.remarks: WORKS OIS evaluates the LineJobGuid and sends an EventRecipeChange message whenever the LineJobGuid changes with production start of a board. There are rare occurrences that SSW cannot assign the LineJobGuid before it sends the production started message. In this case, the occurs when the board leaves station. For SSW 60x and earlier, please use .

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.PickupObservationEvent
member.summary: Occurs periodically when predefined seconds have passed.
member.remarks: The pickup related data is stored in PickupComposite containers which contain accumulated PickupError and Consumption information for a given station and a predefined time span. This messages contains a consumption entry (UsedDetail entries) for each feeder location where pickups occurred in the given time span. It also contains a list of all pickup errors which came up for the given station during the given time scope
member.param: The sender of the event (this object)
The Event args describing the contents.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.PassmodeEvent
member.summary: Occurs when the bypassed flag in the Recipe changes or whenever a station sends a bypassed event, indicating, that the station has been set to pass through mode.
member.param: The sender of the event (this object)
The Event args describing the contents.
member.remarks: The station notifies the WORKS OIS about the deactivation of certain parts of the station or about the deactivation of the whole station. WORKS OIS sends a PassmodeEvent to the monitoring adapter. The Passmode collection contains Passmode flags for those processing locations of the station where the Passmode flag has changed.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.RecipeActivationChangeEvent
member.summary: Only SSW 60x and earlier! Fired after the first board of a new recipe finished production at station (board is moving out of station). A RecipeCollection contains a recipe ID for each processing location where a recipe change has been detected.
member.param: The sender of the event (this object)
The Event args describing the contents.
member.remarks: WORKS OIS evaluates the board message (containing recipe and board name) from station and retrieves the RecipeID based on these properties. Whenever it finds a change in the RecipeID WORKS OIS fires this event. Since this event only occurs AFTER the first board was produced, it is not supported with SSW 70x and higher. Instead used , which is triggered when the first board of a new recipe STARTS production within station.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.SetupUpdateEvent
member.summary: Occurs when WORKS OIS recognizes the occurrence of an alternative component.
member.remarks: The args contains the SetupCollection with a list of Track entries: one entry for each detected alternative component.
member.param: The sender of the event (this object)
The Event args describing the contents.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.RecipeDownloadEvent
member.summary: Occurs when WORKS OIS receives a download event from ASM SIPLACE Pro for a station/conveyor-lane combination. This does not imply that the recipe is active on the station yet. Note: In case of a job download (barcode mode) this event will not get fired for station software 40x and 50x. In case you want to subscribe to setup downloads, use the SPI Adapter oder Line Control Adapter instead.
member.remarks: The event takes place a few seconds after a recipe download has been performed from LineControl to the station(s). A download usually gets performed for all station of a line simultaneously if no station wise download is active. If station wise download is active a download starts with the first station of the line, and the download for the consecutive stations gets performed whenever the stations are ready to download. A DownloadRecipe contains all recipe related properties (recipe, tracks, Boards, Heads, RecipeAddon) WORKS OIS sends a Download Recipe Event for each station/conveyor-lane combination.
member.param: The sender of the event (this object)
The Event args describing the contents.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.LineJobGuidChangedEvent
member.summary:
SSW 70x or 605 is required.
Occurs when OIS detected a change in the line job guid to the previous one produced at given processing location. This event is independent of the timing of .
What is its difference to ?
Answer: the RecipeActivationChangeEvent is signaled after and when board finished production in station.
What is its difference to ?
Answer: the RecipeChangeEvent is signaled after and when board started production in station.
For SSW (< 715 including 605) this event is signaled when either board measurement or component pickup process was started for the first board with the different line job guid.
For SSW 715 and newer the event is triggered when station switches production of new boards to this recipe (= "StartJobCompleted").
In order to lookup recipe details of the active recipe you must lookup the with same line job guid and the latest start time before. Please keep in mind, that you may not yet have received the latest information, since setup changes during board production (= alternative components) will result in recipe updates. In some cases, the will only triggered after
member.param: Forwarded details of the recipe activation event.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.SpeedLossReasonChangedEvent
member.summary:
SSW 715 or later is required
Occurs when station software intentionally changes performance. Reasons can be, for example, operator interaction or temperature changes.
member.param: Forwarded details of the currently active speed loss reasons.

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.BoardProcessedEventReceived
member.summary: Fired when a board is completed within a station (when the board is leaving the station). Comprises all events, state transitions, pickup errors and consumption data for a board in a given station

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.ConfigurationChangedEventReceived
member.summary: Fired when whenever the ASM SIPLACE Pro line configuration changes. Contains the complete line configuration from ASM SIPLACE Pro

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.StationEventReceived
member.summary: Fired when a state transition is triggered in WORKS OIS state machine by a station event.

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.RecipeChangeEventReceived
member.summary: Only for SSW 70x and later. Fired whenever WORKS OIS detected a line job guid change with the production start of a board at station.
member.remarks: WORKS OIS evaluates the LineJobGuid and sends an EventRecipeChange message whenever the LineJobGuid changes with production start of a board. There are rare occurrences that SSW cannot assign the LineJobGuid before it sends the production started message. In this case, the occurs when the board leaves station. For SSW 60x and earlier, please use .

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.PickupObservationEventReceived
member.summary: Fired periodically when predefined seconds have passed.
member.remarks: The pickup related data is stored in PickupComposite containers which contain accumulated PickupError and Consumption information for a given station and a predefined time span. This messages contains a consumption entry (UsedDetail entries) for each feeder location where pickups occurred in the given time span. It also contains a list of all pickup errors which came up for the given station during the given time scope

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.PassmodeEventReceived
member.summary: Fired when the bypassed flag in the Recipe changes or whenever a station sends a bypassed event, indicating, that the station has been set to pass through mode.
member.remarks: The station notifies the WORKS OIS about the deactivation of certain parts of the station or about the deactivation of the whole station. WORKS OIS sends a to the monitoring adapter. The Passmode collection contains Passmode flags for those processing locations of the station where the Passmode flag has changed.

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.RecipeActivationChangeEventReceived
member.summary: Only SSW 60x and earlier! Fired after the first board of a new recipe finished production at station (board is moving out of station). A RecipeCollection contains a recipe ID for each processing location where a recipe change has been detected.
member.remarks: WORKS OIS evaluates the board message (containing recipe and board name) from station and retrieves the RecipeID based on these properties. Whenever it finds a change in the RecipeID WORKS OIS fires this event. Since this event only occurs AFTER the first board was produced, it is not supported with SSW 70x and higher. Instead used , which is triggered when the first board of a new recipe STARTS production within station.

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.SetupUpdateEventReceived
member.summary: Fired when WORKS OIS recognizes the occurrence of an alternative component.
member.remarks: The args contains the SetupCollection with a list of Track entries: one entry for each detected alternative component.

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.RecipeDownloadEventReceived
member.summary: Fired when WORKS OIS receives a download event from ASM SIPLACE Pro for a station/conveyor-lane combination. This does not imply that the recipe is active on the station yet. Note: In case of a job download (barcode mode) this event will not get fired for station software 40x and 50x. In case you want to subscribe to setup downloads, use the SPI Adapter oder Line Control Adapter instead.
member.remarks: The event takes place a few seconds after a recipe download has been performed from LineControl to the station(s). A download usually gets performed for all station of a line simultaneously if no station wise download is active. If station wise download is active a download starts with the first station of the line, and the download for the consecutive stations gets performed whenever the stations are ready to download. A DownloadRecipe contains all recipe related properties (recipe, tracks, Boards, Heads, RecipeAddon) WORKS OIS sends a for each station/conveyor-lane combination.

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.SpliceEventReceived
member.summary: Fired when WORKS OIS receives one or more splice events from the station.

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.HeartBeatEventReceived
member.summary: Is fired typically every 5 minutes. You can use this event to see if the eventing communication is still alive and if you have received all events until a certain point in time.

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.PickupErrorEventReceived
member.summary: Fired when WORKS OIS received a single pickup error from station.

member.summary: Fired whenever a station signals an availability state change, e.g. Producing -> Standby

member.name: E:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReceiverBase.FeederErrorEventReceived
member.summary: Fired when a station signals a feeder error like foil torn without pick-up activity.

member.summary: Fired when OIS detected a change in the line job guid active at a processing location.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Architecture.Objects.ReliableReceiver
member.summary: Receiver class for receiving (reliable) SIPLACE Monitoring events. The SIPLACE Monitoring events are mapped to a .Net event handler for easy handling. The receiver opens a service endpoint with the given address and binding which is being called by OIB Eventing. After having instantiated this class, you need to subscribe for monitoring events at OIB Core by using Subscriber proxy.

member.remarks: The event occurs periodically when predefined seconds have passed. The pickup related data is stored in PickupComposite containers which contain accumulated PickupError and Consumption information for a given station and a predefined time span. It also contains a list of all pickup errors which came up for the given station during the given time scope

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.EventArgs.RecipeChangeEventArgs
member.summary: The RecipeChangeEventArgs class.
member.remarks: The event occurs when Monitoring Service detects a change of active recipe within a station board message. Monitoring Service evaluates the Board Message (containing the Recipe and Board name) from the station (also works for non Sirio stations) and retrieves the RecipeID based on these properties. Whenever it finds a change in the RecipeID it fires this event. Since the generation of this message is based on the station board message (sent by the station after the board processing steps have been finished), the Monitoring Service sends this message after the board left the station (board is leaving the station). A RecipeCollection contains a recipe ID for each processing location where a recipe change has been detected.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardIdentifier
member.summary: Collection of all known board identifiers.

remarks.para: Within a station, boards are identified by several identifiers. This collection contains current and previously signaled identifiers for the board.

Please keep in mind, that manually removing/entering boards as well as restart of station software will trigger new ids. WORKS OIS tries to recover the identity of a board with station restart. This will only succeed, if station signals at least one of the previously known identifiers. If it fails (no identifier could be matched), a new transaction GUID is created.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingStepEnum
member.summary: Describes what type of board tracking event was triggered.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingStepEnum.Unknown
member.summary: Board step is not known.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingStepEnum.Appearance
member.summary: Board is first signaled by station.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingStepEnum.ProcessingSectionEnter
member.summary: Conveyor started board movement into processing section.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingStepEnum.ProcessingSectionArrived
member.summary: Conveyor stopped board movement at next processing section. Clamping follows immediately.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingStepEnum.ProductionStarted
member.summary: Station started production at processing section. Be aware that it may also happen with early pick up, thus board may not yet be clamped. This step is only transmitted, if board recipe has at least one production step at this section. Sequence of and is not fixed.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingStepEnum.ProductionFinished
member.summary: Station finished production at processing section. Removing clamping follows immediately. This step is only transmitted, if board recipe has at least one production step at this section.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingStepEnum.ProcessingSectionDepart
member.summary: Board is moving out of a processing section. Clamping was removed.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingStepEnum.StationDepart
member.summary: Board is moving out of station.

member.name: F:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingStepEnum.DisAppearance
member.summary: Station no longer signals this board.

member.name: T:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingEventData
member.summary: The object BoardTrackingEventData contains the data of one or more board events for one station.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingEventData.Identifier
member.summary: A collection of identifiers for this board.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingEventData.VirtualLane
member.summary: The virtual conveyor lane where the board is produced. A virtual lane id is defined by which physical lane of a dual-lane machine is connected to this lane. Normally the virtual lane id of a machine is identical to the physical lane identifier (1->1 (=right lane), 2->2 (=left lane)). But in case of back-to-back solutions this changes (printer 1: 1->1 (=right lane), printer 2: 1->2 (= left lane)).

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingEventData.Section
member.summary: The conveyor section number. When the board tracking event was triggered, the board was in this conveyor section. The same section number may be reported for several For our placement machines, valid values are in between [0,6].
member.remarks:
The conveyor is physically divided into several belt sections. It depends on machine and conveyor type, how many belt sections exist. Our default single processing area placement machines signal:
1Station input section: relates to Appearance
2Processing section of processing area 1: relates to ProcessingSectionEnter, ProductionStarted, ProcessingSectionArrived, ProductionFinished
3Output section of station: relates to ProcessingSectionDepart
4External lane connected to station output section: relates to StationDepart
Our default dual processing area placement machines signal:
1Station input section: relates to Appearance
2Processing section of processing area 1: relates to ProcessingSectionEnter, ProductionStarted, ProcessingSectionArrived, ProductionFinished
3Middle section in between processing area 1 and 2: relates to ProcessingSectionDepart
4Processing section of processing area 2: relates to ProcessingSectionEnter, ProductionStarted, ProcessingSectionArrived, ProductionFinished
5Output section of station: relates to ProcessingSectionDepart
6External lane connected to station output section: relates to StationDepart
Special case 0 = undefined: when a board no longer is known within station software, its disappearance is signaled with section=0.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingEventData.Step
member.summary: Which tracking step was reached by a board.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.BoardTrackingEventData.TimeStamp
member.summary: When was the given production step finished in UTC.

member.summary: The list of panels is transmitted once for each with the first board event after all panels were scanned.

Since this view is irrelevant for MES systems, a new encoding was introduced with OIB 6.2 SP1 HF6 that maps halts due to missing component supply to unscheduled downtime. This encoding is found at .

member.summary: If set to true, this means that this type of panel has been marked in SIPLACE Pro to be counted as singe circuit. SIPLACE Pro 11.0 and higher allows to mark Panel Matrix elements to be counted as Assembled PCB. It is up to the user to set or reset this flag. Station SW >= 707 forwards this information to the Monitoring Service. Other station SW versions don't provide this flag. If the CountAsAssembledPcb is not available Monitoring Service sets this value to null.

member.summary: A reason why station performance is reduced.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.SpeedLossReason.DataContract
member.summary: Gets the internal data contract.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.SpeedLossReason.Id
member.summary: Unique identifier of station for each active reason.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.SpeedLossReason.Type
member.summary:
Description of speed loss reason:
Value Description
0Unknown type. In this case station signals speed loss, but type is unknown to WORKS OIS version.
1A segment was deactivated
2PCB measurement done after placement (GUI setting)
3Periodic SPS check active (GUI setting)
4Station runs in emergency mode

member.summary: DateTime in UTC when the station detected the splice

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.SpliceEvent.RemainingQuantity
member.summary:
The splice connects two packagings: the preceding and the succeeding packaging. This splice event is fired on packaging changeover. However, when the feeder is removed after the beginning of the splice plate and before the packaging changeover, the station fires the splice event on feeder removal.
The RemainingQuantity of a SpliceEvent is the amount of components left on the preceding packaging, i.e. the amount of components until the packaging changeover is expected.

member.summary: Full path including name and folders of the board originally from SIPLACE Pro.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.ProcessedBoard.BuildTimePa1
member.summary:
Build time in processing area 1 in milliseconds. This information is only available if the board has been produced by a station with station SW 7xx. -1 indicates an invalid entry.
This represents the time a station used to process a certain board in a given processing area. This definition conforms to the IPC 9850 specification. It includes
Fiducial Read
Nozzle Exchange
Placement Time
Transferred to the SIPLACE station terminology this is the time between the
First Measuring activity
Last Placement activity

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.ProcessedBoard.BuildTimePa2
member.summary:
Build time in processing area 2 in milliseconds. This information is only available if the board has been produced by a station with station SW 7xx. -1 indicates an invalid entry.
This represents the time a station used to process a certain board in a given processing area. This definition conforms to the IPC 9850 specification. It includes
Fiducial Read
Nozzle Exchange
Placement Time
Transferred to the SIPLACE station terminology this is the time between the
First Measuring activity
Last Placement activity

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.ProcessedBoard.ProducedPanels
member.summary: List of produced panels. In case of StationSW less than 707 this List is usually empty. With 707 and higher this list should contain valid entries

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.ProcessedBoard.BuildTime
member.summary: Build time in seconds. For stations less than 7xx this value comes from the station and for 7xx and higher is filled with the maximum value of BuildTimePa1 and BuildTimePa2

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.ProcessedBoard.BuildTimeInt
member.summary: Build time in seconds. For stations less than 7xx this value comes from the station and for 7xx and higher is filled with the maximum value of BuildTimePa1 and BuildTimePa2

member.summary: 0: Undefined 1: Alternating (Both gantries work on both lanes) 2: I-Placement (Right gantry places on right lane, left gantry places on left lane) 3: Virtual I-Placement Right (heads in the first placement area are placing alternating on the right conveyor and heads of the second placement area are placing alternating on the left conveyor) 4: Virtual I-Placement Left (heads in the first placement area are placing alternating on the left conveyor and heads of the second placement area are placing alternating on the right conveyor) 5: Alternating optimized with option Equal cycle times for left and right lane (Only occurs with SIPLACE Pro 16.0 or higher.)

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.RecipeAddOn.BuildTime
member.summary: Time from first Measurement to last placement activity in milliseconds

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.RecipeAddOn.StationTactTime
member.summary: lStationTactTime = BuildTime + TransportTime in milliseconds

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.RecipeAddOn.ParallelProcessingFactor
member.summary: 2 if station runs in IPlacement mode n if the station runs in a cluster of n parallel stations 2*n, if station runs in I-Placement mode and if it runs in a cluster of n parallel stations 1 in all other cases

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.RecipeAddOn.SteppingActive

false if the HeadSteps are using only one stopper position true if the HeadSteps are using more than one stopper position.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.StateChangeReason.AssistId
member.summary: Gets or sets the identifier of this assist. This must be defined by the assist source and must be maintained consistently for the lifetime and the scope for one source id. The Ids can be reused when the assists have been removed by the originator. The assists do not need to survive a "reboot" of the data source. The assists are being considered to be new, when an assist source has been restarted. This value is mandatory

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.StateChangeReason.ErrorNo
member.summary: Gets or sets the error no. This corresponds to the ScenarioId in the Operator Assist interface.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.StateChangeReason.DescriptionTranslations
member.summary: Gets or sets the description translations for other languages than English. This is a dictionary of language tags and the corresponding translation in that language. The key values are either Cultures or Locales as defined in Culture names and identifiers . Max length of key is 10 characters. Max length of value is 256 characters which might include multi-line text. Filling this collection is optional. The CultureInfo class specifies a unique name for each culture, based on RFC 4646. The name is a combination of an ISO 639 two-letter lowercase culture code associated with a language and an ISO 3166 two-letter uppercase subculture code associated with a country or region. The language needs to be associated with the particular region where it is spoken, and this is done by using locale (language + location). For example: fr is the code for French language. fr-FR means French language in France. So, fr specifies only the language whereas fr-FR is the locale

member.summary: Public constructor to be used within Proxy

member.summary: Internal Constructor for creating the Monitoring objects
member.param: The data coming from the OIS service

member.summary: Gets the internal data contract.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.Monitoring.Proxy.Business.Objects.StationEvent.BoardNumber
member.summary:
The Board number is a station internal number which identifies the board in the machine, when it travels through the machine.
The Board number is only set for those event types, which have a board context like PCB_BEGIN and PCB_END. The default value is 0 (zero). The board number is unique in the scope of the machine. The Board number can not be used to track one board through the line. Therefore a potentially used barcode can be used. Be aware, that the counter will be reset, when it exceeds a maximum value and when the station will be restarted. So it is unique only for a period of time.
